title: Kuratowski and Ryll-Nardzewski measurable selection theorem
summary: In mathematics, the Kuratowski–Ryll-Nardzewski measurable selection theorem is a result from measure theory that gives a sufficient condition for a set-valued function to have a measurable selection function.[1][2][3]  It is named after the Polish mathematicians Kazimierz Kuratowski and Czesław Ryll-Nardzewski.[4]
